alert.note: Alert for Orange (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 6:32PM EDT until September 17 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Orange. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Apopka, Ocoee, Winter Garden, Winter Park, Maitland, Windermere, Bay Lake, Oak Ridge, Conway, Pine Hills, College Park, Orlando International Airport, Lockhart, Azalea Park, Goldenrod, University Of Central Florida, Belle Isle, Universal Studios and Wet N Wild Water Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
